Nissan.name: Nissan Maxima
Nissan.description: Nissan's flagship sedan primarily in North America, the Middle East, South Korea, and China—and currently in its eighth generation

Nissan.name: Nissan Armada
Nissan.description: The Nissan Armada (retrospectively referred to unofficially as the Nissan Pathfinder Armada) is a full-size SUV manufactured by Nissan for the North American market.

Nissan.name: Nissan Kicks
Nissan.description: The Nissan Kicks (Japanese: 日産・キックス, Hepburn: Nissan Kikkusu) is a subcompact crossover SUV produced by Nissan since 2016

Nissan.name: Nissan Hybrid
Nissan.description: The Nissan Hybrid is a mid-size car manufactured by Nissan since 1992. It is a continuation of the Nissan Bluebird line

Nissan.name: Nissan Pathfinder
Nissan.description: Until the third-generation model, the Pathfinder is based on Nissan's compact pickup truck platform which it shares with the Navara/Frontier.

Nissan.name: Nissan Rogue
Nissan.description: The Nissan Rogue is a compact crossover SUV produced by the Japanese automobile manufacturer Nissan.

Toyota.name: Toyota Avalon
Toyota.description: The Toyota Avalon (Japanese: トヨタ・アバロン, Hepburn: Toyota Abaron) is a full-size sedan produced by Toyota. It is Toyota's largest front-wheel drive sedan and serves as its flagship sedan in the United States, Canada, China and the Middle East.

Toyota.name: Toyota Corolla
Toyota.description: The Toyota Corolla is a series of compact cars (formerly subcompact) manufactured and marketed globally by the Japanese automaker Toyota Motor Corporation. Introduced in 1966, the Corolla was the best-selling car worldwide by 1974 and has been one of the best-selling cars in the world since then.

Toyota.name: Toyota Fortuner
Toyota.description: The Toyota Fortuner, also known as the Toyota SW4, is a mid-size SUV manufactured by the Japanese automaker Toyota since 2004. Built on the Hilux pickup truck platform, it features two/three rows of seats and is available in either rear-wheel drive or four-wheel drive configuration.

Toyota.name: Toyota Hilux
Toyota.description: The Toyota Hilux (Japanese: トヨタ・ハイラックス, Hepburn: Toyota Hairakkusu), stylized as HiLux and historically as Hi-Lux, is a series of pickup trucks produced and marketed by the Japanese automobile manufacturer Toyota. The majority of these vehicles are sold as pickup truck or cab chassis variants, although they could be configured in a variety of body styles.

Toyota.name: Toyota Prius
Toyota.description: The Toyota Prius is a compact/small family liftback (supermini/subcompact sedan until 2003) produced by Toyota. The Prius has a hybrid drivetrain, combined with an internal combustion engine and an electric motor. Initially offered as a four-door sedan

Toyota.name: Toyota Rush
Toyota.description: The Toyota Rush is a mini SUV produced by the Japanese automobile manufacturer Daihatsu since 1997 as the successor to the F300 series Rocky

Mercedes.name: Mercedes-Benz CLS
Mercedes.description: The Mercedes-Benz CLS (initially called the CLS-Class) is a series of executive cars produced by Mercedes-Benz from October 2004 to August 2023.

Mercedes.name: Mercedes-Benz GLA
Mercedes.description: The Mercedes-Benz GLA is a subcompact luxury crossover SUV manufactured and marketed by Mercedes-Benz over two generations. It is essentially the SUV equivalent of the A-Class, and the smallest SUV marketed by the brand.

Mercedes.name: Mercedes-Benz GLB
Mercedes.description: The Mercedes-Benz GLB (model code X247) is a crossover SUV produced by Mercedes-Benz. It was unveiled by the German manufacturer Daimler AG on 10 June 2019 in Park City, Utah.[4] It was previously unveiled as a concept car to the public at the Shanghai Auto Show in April 2019.

Mercedes.name: Mercedes-Benz GLC
Mercedes.description: The Mercedes-Benz GLC is a compact luxury crossover SUV introduced in 2015 for the 2016 model year that replaced the GLK-Class. According to Mercedes-Benz, it is the SUV equivalent to the C-Class.

Mercedes.name: Mercedes-Benz GLE
Mercedes.description: The Mercedes-Benz GLE, formerly Mercedes-Benz M-Class, is a mid-size luxury SUV produced by the German manufacturer Mercedes-Benz since 1997. In terms of size, it is slotted in between the smaller GLC and the larger GLS, the latter with which it shares platforms.

Mercedes.name: Mercedes-Benz Maybach
Mercedes.description: The Maybach 57 (chassis no. W240) and 62 (chassis no. V240) were the first automobile models of the Maybach brand since its revival by DaimlerChrysler AG (now Mercedes-Benz Group AG). They are derived from the Mercedes-Benz Maybach concept car presented at the 1997 Tokyo Motor Show.

BMW.name: BMW I7
BMW.description: The BMW i7 model is the battery electric variant of the G70.[60] Unveiled simultaneously with its ICE counterpart,[61] the vehicle features a similar powertrain setup to the iX crossover SUV, including an excited synchronous electric motor at the rear for rear-wheel drive models while on all-wheel drive models, two motors are placed at both front and rear axles

BMW.name: BMW X3
BMW.description: The BMW X3 is an SUV manufactured by BMW since 2003, based on the BMW 3 Series platform. Now in its third generation, BMW markets the car as a Sports Activity Vehicle, the company's proprietary descriptor for its X-line luxury vehicles.

BMW.name: BMW X4
BMW.description: The BMW X4 is a compact luxury crossover SUV manufactured by BMW since 2014. It is marketed as a sports activity coupé (SAC),[1] the second model from BMW marketed as such after the X6, and features styling elements and the roofline of a traditional two-door coupé

BMW.name: BMW X5
BMW.description: The BMW X5 is a mid-size luxury crossover SUV produced by BMW.[1] The X5 made its debut in 1999 as the E53 model. It was BMW's first SUV

BMW.name: BMW X6
BMW.description: The BMW X6 is a mid-size luxury crossover SUV by German automaker BMW. The BMW X6 is the originator of the sports activity coupé (SAC), referencing its sloping rear roof design.

BMW.name: BMW X7
BMW.description: The BMW X7 is a full-sized luxury sport utility vehicle manufactured by BMW. It is BMW's largest and 2nd most expensive SUV in its line-up

Audi.name: Audi A1
Audi.description: The Audi A1 is a supermini car launched by Audi at the 2010 Geneva Motor Show. Sales of the initial three-door A1 model started in Germany in August 2010, with the United Kingdom following in November 2010

Audi.name: Audi A6
Audi.description: The Audi A6 is an executive car made by the German company Audi since 1994. Now in its fifth generation, the successor to the Audi 100 is manufactured in Neckarsulm, Germany, and is available in saloon and estate configurations, the latter marketed by Audi as the Avant.

Audi.name: Audi Q7
Audi.description: The Audi Q7 is a crossover SUV made by the German manufacturer Audi, unveiled in September 2005 at the Frankfurt Motor Show.

Audi.name: Audi Q8
Audi.description: The Audi Q8 is a mid-size luxury crossover SUV coupé made by Audi that was launched in 2018

Audi.name: Audi Q9
Audi.description: Audi Q9 is in the testing and fine-tuning phase of its development. It will sit above the Q7 in the brand's lineup, taking on the flagship crossover role.

Audi.name: Audi R8
Audi.description: The Audi R8 is a mid-engine, 2-seater sports car, which uses Audi's trademark quattro permanent all-wheel drive system.
